page.title: 08HEANOR COMMUNITY CENTRE
page.content: Heanor Community Centre opened in March 1984 and incorporated the swimming baths named after a local man Sgt.W.Gregg V.C.D.C.M.MM. Its first manager is Mr Murray Calladine who feels the aim of the centre is to help educate the public in the use of their leisure time, and that the new Britannia Park facilities will not be a detraction. Swimming is extremely popular and the pool is used by both Heanor and Ilkeston Swimming Clubs and the Sub Aqua. The clubs using the meeting rooms include the Rotary, the computer club, mother and toddlers, dancing, keep fit, discos, and they are also of use for private functions. Numerous sports are available including roller skating, badminton, karate, bowls and volley ball whilst in the outdoor area there is tennis, football, hockey and netball.
